meanings.definition: To confine or segregate a group of people, typically based on race or socioeconomic status, in a specific area or neighborhood.
meanings.sent1: The government ghettoized certain communities, forcing them to live in a small area.
meanings.sent2: The minority group felt ghettoized as they were pushed to the outskirts of the city.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a penguin being ghettoized to the warm desert made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was ghettoized by the strict rules of the art school.
meanings.sent5: The image of the fence ghettoizing the playground will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: To isolate or treat as inferior or separate from the rest of society.
meanings.sent1: The popular kids ghettoized the new student, making them feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: She felt ghettoized by her colleagues who never included her in their activities.
meanings.sent3: The cat ghettoized the new kitten, refusing to share its toys.
meanings.sent4: His unique style was ghettoized by the mainstream fashion industry.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher ghettoized any student who didn't follow the rules.
